content.question: <math alttext="(in molar)" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>M</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> Volume of Sample <math alttext="(in milliliters)" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mpadded><mi mathvariant="normal">L</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> Volume of Standardized <math alttext="N a O H, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mi>NaOH</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>Added to Reach Equivalence Point <math alttext="(in milliliters)" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>mL</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> <math alttext="H C l O 4, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>HClO</mi><mn>4</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> <math alttext="0.100" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.100</mn></math> <math alttext="25.0" overflow="scroll"><mn>25.0</mn></math> <math alttext="24.0" overflow="scroll"><mn>24.0</mn></math> <math alttext="H C l O, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mi>HClO</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> <math alttext="0.200" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.200</mn></math> <math alttext="25.0" overflow="scroll"><mn>25.0</mn></math> <math alttext="Question mark" overflow="scroll"><mo>?</mo></math> Samples of two different acids are titrated using the same standardized solution of <math alttext="N a O H, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mi>NaOH</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>. According to the data in the table above, how many milliliters of the standardized <math alttext="N a O H, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mi>NaOH</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> are required to reach the equivalence point when the <math alttext="25.0 milliliters" overflow="scroll"><mn>25.0</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>mL</mi></math> sample of <math alttext="0.200 molar H C l O, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.200</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>HClO</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> is titrated?

choices.label: It cannot be determined without knowing the values of <math alttext="K a" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>a</mi></msub></math> for <math alttext="H C l O 4, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>HClO</mi><mn>4</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> and <math alttext="H C l O, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mi>HClO</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>.

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
